channel.title: Play wav file after hypothesis – Politepix

item.title: Play wav file after hypothesis
item.dc:creator: kelvinKW
item.description:
Hello!

Is there any method that can allow OpenEars, after recognition
, playing a wav/mp3 file after hypothesis?

Thank you!

item.title: Reply To: Play wav file after hypothesis
item.dc:creator: Halle Winkler
item.description:
Welcome,

This is outside of OpenEars’ API since it isn’t intended to be a general-purpose audio toolkit, but you can just play back a WAV using AVAudioPlayer after receiving a hypothesis.

item.title: Reply To: Play wav file after hypothesis
item.dc:creator: kelvinKW
item.description:
Thanks for your answer!

But how can I modify the source code ?
Is it modify at self.heardtextview.text?

item.title: Reply To: Play wav file after hypothesis
item.dc:creator: Halle Winkler
item.description: You can put AVAudioPlayer playback in – (void) pocketsphinxDidReceiveHypothesis:(NSString *)hypothesis recognitionScore:(NSString *)recognitionScore utteranceID:(NSString *)utteranceID.

item.title: Reply To: Play wav file after hypothesis
item.dc:creator: kelvinKW
item.description:
Sorry, I need another help.

The situation is that, I want to produce different mp3 sound for each recognition.

Example is that:

When pocketsplinx receive hypothesis A, after recognition, it will play
A.mp3

When pocketsplinx receive hypothesis B, after recognition, it will play
B.mp3

How can I modify the source code to let such happen?

thank you!

item.title: Reply To: Play wav file after hypothesis
item.dc:creator: Halle Winkler
item.description: It’s the same answer as my first answer above. OpenEars doesn’t play audio files, so you don’t have to modify OpenEars’ source code in order to do that. You will put the logic for playing audio files in your own app code, and you can use OpenEars’ API to decide when to trigger that code in your app.

item.title: Reply To: Play wav file after hypothesis
item.dc:creator: kelvinKW
item.description:
“You will put the logic for playing audio files in your own app code, and you can use OpenEarsâ€™ API to decide when to trigger that code in your app.”

Can you explain this with more detail?
Since I am quite confusing about this.

thank you

item.title: Reply To: Play wav file after hypothesis
item.dc:creator: Halle Winkler
item.description:
Hi,

Sorry, that is getting into more general questions about how to use Objective-C to develop apps. As much as I wish I could assist with those more general questions, I only have the resources to offer help with OpenEars here.
